desc: Clustering, dimensionality reduction, and pattern discovery
name: Unsupervised Learning

note_models.name: ML Interview Card

fields: How does k-means clustering work and what are its limitations?

Algorithm: Initialize k centroids → assign points → update centroids → repeat
Objective: Minimize within-cluster sum of squares (WCSS)
Limitations: Need to specify k, assumes spherical clusters, sensitive to initialization
Solutions: K-means++, elbow method, try multiple initializations
What is Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and how does it work?

Goal: Find directions of maximum variance in data
Method: Eigenvalue decomposition of covariance matrix
Components: Orthogonal vectors ordered by explained variance
Use cases: Dimensionality reduction, visualization, noise reduction
How does DBSCAN work and what are its advantages over k-means?

Method: Density-based clustering using eps (radius) and min_samples
Core points: Have ≥ min_samples within eps radius
Advantages: Finds arbitrary shapes, handles noise, auto-determines clusters
Disadvantages: Sensitive to hyperparameters, struggles with varying densities
What is the difference between PCA and t-SNE?

PCA: Linear method, preserves global structure, fast
t-SNE: Non-linear method, preserves local structure, slow
PCA use: Dimensionality reduction, preprocessing
t-SNE use: Visualization, exploratory analysis (mainly 2D/3D)
